 36 -class IMU(Platform): 

 37      """ 
 38      An IMU hardware platform with one or more sensors. 
 39      """ 
 40   
 41      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 42   
 43      @abstractproperty 

 44 -    def sensors(self): 

 45          """ 
 46          List of L{Sensor} objects on the platform. 
 47          """ 
 48          pass 

 49   

 50 -class StandardIMU(IMU): 

 51      """ 
 52      An IMU with accelerometer, magnetometer, gyroscope, ADC, Timer and radio. 
 53   
 54      More complex designs may not fit this structure, but it provides a useful 
 55      interface which simplifies repeating experiments across multiple IMU types. 
 56   
 57      @ivar accelerometer: The L{Accelerometer} on the platform. 
 58      @ivar magnetometer: The L{Magnetometer} on the platform. 
 59      @ivar gyroscope: The L{Gyroscope} on the platform. 
 60      @ivar adc: The L{ADC} used to sample the sensors. 
 61      @ivar timer: The L{Timer} used for timekeeping on the platform. 
 62      @ivar radio: The L{Radio} on the platform. 
 63      """ 
 64   
 65      @property 

 66 -    def sensors(self): 

 67          return [self.accelerometer, self.magnetometer, self.gyroscope] 

 68   
 69      @property 

 70 -    def components(self): 

 71          return self.sensors + [self.adc, self.timer, self.radio] 

 72   

 73 -class IdealIMU(StandardIMU): 

 74      """ 
 75      An IMU with idealised models for all components. 
 76      """ 
 77   

 78 -    def __init__(self, simulation=None, trajectory=None): 

 79          self.accelerometer = IdealAccelerometer(self) 
 80          self.magnetometer = IdealMagnetometer(self) 
 81          self.gyroscope = IdealGyroscope(self) 
 82          self.adc = IdealADC(self) 
 83          self.timer = IdealTimer(self) 
 84          self.radio = IdealRadio(self) 
 85          StandardIMU.__init__(self, simulation, trajectory) 

 86   

 87 -class MagicIMU(StandardIMU): 

 88      """ 
 89      An IMU with idealised components including a fictional gravity sensor. 
 90      """ 

 91 -    def __init__(self, simulation=None, trajectory=None): 

 92          self.accelerometer = IdealGravitySensor(self) 
 93          self.magnetometer = IdealMagnetometer(self) 
 94          self.gyroscope = IdealGyroscope(self) 
 95          self.adc = IdealADC(self) 
 96          self.timer = IdealTimer(self) 
 97          self.radio = IdealRadio(self) 
 98          StandardIMU.__init__(self, simulation, trajectory) 

 99   

100 -class Orient3IMU(StandardIMU): 

101      """ 
102      Simple model of the Orient-3 IMU from the University of Edinburgh. 
103   
104      The Orient-3 is an updated version of the Orient-2 design described in 
105      A. Young, M. Ling and D. K. Arvind, "Orient-2: A Realtime Wireless Posture 
106      Tracking System Using Local Orientation Estimation", in Proc. 4th Workshop 
107      on Embedded Network Sensors, pp 53-57, ACM, 2007. 
108   
109      This model still excludes a number of factors such as sampling delays, and 
110      currently includes an ideal radio model, but provides reasonably realistic 
111      sensor data. The sensor models are based on a combination of empirical 
112      characterisation and datasheet parameters. 
113      """ 
114   
115      @prepend_method_doc(Platform) 

116 -    def __init__(self, simulation=None, trajectory=None, rng=None): 

117          """ 
118          @param rng: L{np.random.RandomState} from which to draw imperfections. 
119          """ 
120          self.adc = QuantisingADC(self, bits=12, vref=1.65) 
121          adc_lsb = 3.3/2**self.adc._bits 
122          self.timer = ParametricTimer(self, frequency=32768, freqError=30, rng=rng) 
123          self.accelerometer = MMA7260Q(self, sensitivity='6g', 
124                  noiseStdDev=15.3*adc_lsb, rng=rng) 
125          self.magnetometer = HMC105x(self, noiseStdDev=8.1*adc_lsb, rng=rng) 
126          self.gyroscope = ADXRS300(self, sensitivity='1200deg/s', 
127                  noiseStdDev=1*adc_lsb, rng=rng) 
128          self.radio = IdealRadio(self) 
129          StandardIMU.__init__(self, simulation, trajectory)
